page.title: 01THE MILLAND VALLEY
page.content: this 12 square kilometre block consists mainly of the milland valley which is a depression surrounded by small hills the highest of which is 183m above sea level and the lowest part of the valley is 50m. the northern hills are a watershed and several streams flow offit southwards towards the river rother. the valley is classified as an area of natural beauty with large areas of farm and woodland. the soil is mainly clay. to the north of the hills the land completely changes. the land remains at the higher level and has sandy soil with large areas of rough common land. this area is cut by the main A3 london to portsmouth road and the railway line, just including liphook station. this area extends into hampshire, the rest being in sussex.
